review: Pros:1. At 20$ (40$ now) it was quite cheap2. That is about itCons:1. Bluetooth whitelist. You are not allowed to connect any bluetooth device to the Stick save the ones allowed by Amazon. Many of us have old bluetooth keyboards and mice laying around and I really don't appreciate having to go purchase another one just to render the device useable.2. Remote with or without voice is just terrible. The lack of a hovering mouse just slows everything down and while they could have added such functionality into the phone remote they refused to do so and made the purchase of a whitelisted bluetooth device almost necessary just to use.3. Does not support the regular Amazon Appstore at all and apps sideloaded from the Amazon Appstore will simply force close because the DRM is different.4. No browser but then, how would anyone ever use it without a functional input device anyway?Thoughts:The Fire Stick had a chance to be pretty darn good and the hardware inside of it would suggest that it should be pretty good. Unfortunately after several months of attempting to use it and just going back, after a fit of rage, to a jury rigged set up of an old phone+hdmi and a bluetooth keyboard (flawless pairing I might add) I have no choice but to say that this is hands down the worst thing I have ever purchased from Amazon and that includes some really stupid stuff. At the very least though all of that stuff either worked as advertised or was simply broken through little or no fault of the seller. The Fire Stick is neither as it does not truly compete with the Chromecast or any Chinese Android box/stick as those actually work and are bluetooth device agnostic. If I could rate the Fire Stick lower than a 1 star I would but unfortunately 1/5 is the worst it will allow me
